column4: Google seeks to dismiss U.S. antitrust lawsuit over Android

column4: CME Group  Thomson Reuters win race to replace London silver fix
column5: LONDON  July 11 The Chicago Mercantile Exchange (CME) and Thomson Reuters Benchmark Services Ltd will operate an electronic silver price benchmark when the current 117-year-old process  known as the "fix"  is disbanded in August  the London Bullion Market Association (LBMA) said on Friday.

column4: U.S. senators ask Gilead to explain cost of Sovaldi hepatitis drug
column5: Two members of the U.S. Senate Finance Committee  including Chairman Ron Wyden  on Friday asked Gilead Sciences Inc to defend the more than $80 000 cost of its breakthrough  treatment for hepatitis C  citing the expense to federal healthcare programs.

column4: Investor lawsuit accuses Lions Gate of concealing SEC probe

column5: (Updates source  adds comments from spokesman  shares  details)

column4: Mondelez to separate cheese  grocery business in Europe - Bloomberg
column5: July 11 Oreo cookies maker Mondelez International Inc is separating its European cheese and grocery business into a standalone entity in a move that could lead to a sale or spinoff  Bloomberg reported  citing a source.

column4: Exclusive: Mylan near multibillion-dollar deal for Abbott drug assets - sources
column5: NEW YORK U.S. generic drugmaker Mylan Inc is in advanced talks to acquire a multibillion-dollar portfolio of established products from Abbott Laboratories  people familiar with the matter said.

column4: Demand for personal computers still erratic  outlook unstable
column5: SAN FRANCISCO/SEATTLE  July 11 Improved demand for personal computers after years of declines may not last as emerging markets remain weak and recent corporate upgrades in the United States and Europe may prove fleeting.

column4: Shire confirms in talks with AbbVie on takeover bid
column5: Shire Plc on Friday confirmed it has held a meeting with U.S. drugmaker AbbVie Inc to discuss AbbVie's takeover bid for the Dublin-based maker of drugs for rare diseases.

column4: US STOCKS-Futures up  but indexes on track for worst week in months
column5: NEW YORK  July 11 U.S. stock index futures were modestly higher on Friday  indicating a rebound from recent losses  though major indexes remained on track for their biggest weekly decline since April.

column4: Allergan asks stockholders not to act on Pershing Square proposal
column5: July 11 Allergan Inc advised its stockholders to refrain from taking any action in response to Pershing Square Capital Management's proposal to replace a majority of the botox maker's board.

column4: America Movil asset sale should be across the board: Slim
column5: NEW YORK/MEXICO CITY America Movil  Latin America's biggest telecoms company  will move quickly to put an "attractive" cross-section of the company up for sale as it sheds assets to escape tougher regulation of the phone and broadcasting markets in Mexico  billionaire owner Carlos Slim said.

column4: America Movil asset sale should be across the board: Slim

column4: AB InBev thirsty for growth in Asia  but Africa less promising -CEO
column5: RIO DE JANEIRO  July 11 Anheuser-Busch InBev SA   the world's largest brewer  sees great growth opportunities in Asia but prospects are lukewarm in Africa  Chief Executive Carlos Brito said on Friday.

column5: * Wheat prices near 4-month lows  corn prices also falling

column4: UPDATE 1-Cargill plant in Ukraine occupied by armed group
column5: LONDON  July 11 A group of armed individuals has occupied a Cargill Inc sunflower-seed crushing plant in Ukraine's eastern Donetsk region after it was closed due to the increased tensions in the area  the company said on Friday.

column4: Obama  corporate giants announce plan to boost suppliers
column5: WASHINGTON  July 11 President Barack Obama is enlisting several major U.S. and multinational companies to draw attention to an initiative aimed at helping small businesses expand and hire workers.

column4: U.S. court rejects AU Optronics appeal of $500 million fine
column5: NEW YORK A U.S. court on Thursday rejected an appeal by Taiwan-based AU Optronics Corp of the $500 million criminal fine the company was ordered to pay in 2012 after a conviction for price-fixing in the market for liquid crystal display panels.

column4: UPDATE 3-U.S. court rejects AU Optronics appeal of $500 mln fine
column5: NEW YORK  July 10 A U.S. court on Thursday rejected an appeal by Taiwan-based AU Optronics Corp  of the $500 million criminal fine the company was ordered to pay in 2012 after a conviction for price-fixing in the market for liquid crystal display panels.

column4: Brazil's Bradesco unfazed over its stake in BES  paper says
column5: SAO PAULO  July 11 Banco Bradesco SA's  3 percent stake in Portugal's Banco Espírito Santo SA  is small and poses no significant impact to Brazil's second-largest private-sector lender  Chief Executive Officer Luiz Carlos Trabuco told a local newspaper on Friday.

column4: UPDATE 1-Bank of America names new SE Asia head amid financial deal boom

column5: NEW YORK    It is an axiom of the financial crisis that Goldman Sachs realized before any of the other big banks that the mortgage-backed securities market was going to implode in 2007. Goldman dumped MBS and shorted the market  turning a profit in its mortgage department when every other major financial institution suffered record losses.
